                             /tasks_new/pdfbox_pdfbox-full-01/fuzz-tooling/build/out/pdfbox/jstack.txt                              
                    INFO     ===Evaluator Result===                                                                 evaluator.py:204
                             PatchStatus.VULNERABLE                                                                                 
                             ===Evaluator Diff===                                                                                   
                             --- a/pdfbox/src/main/java/org/apache/pdfbox/pdfparser/XrefParser.java                                 
                             +++ b/pdfbox/src/main/java/org/apache/pdfbox/pdfparser/XrefParser.java                                 
                             @@ -571,6 +571,42 @@                                                                                   
                                   * @return false on parsing error                                                                 
                                   * @throws IOException If an IO error occurs.                                                     
                                   */                                                                                               
                             +    /**                                                                                               
                             +     * Splits 'line' on whitespace into at most maxTokens tokens.                                     
                             +     * Runs in O(line.length()), avoiding regex overhead.                                             
                             +     */                                                                                               
                             +    private static String[] manualSplit(String line, int maxTokens)                                   
                             +    {                                                                                                 
                             +        String[] tokens = new String[maxTokens];                                                      
                             +        int tokenCount = 0;                                                                           
                             +        int len = line.length();                                                                      
                             +        int i = 0;                                                                                    
                             +        while (i < len && tokenCount < maxTokens)                                                     
                             +        {                                                                                             
                             +            while (i < len && Character.isWhitespace(line.charAt(i)))                                 
                             +            {                                                                                         
                             +                i++;                                                                                  
                             +            }                                                                                         
                             +            if (i >= len)                                                                             
                             +            {                                                                                         
                             +                break;                                                                                
                             +            }                                                                                         
                             +            int start = i;                                                                            
                             +            while (i < len && !Character.isWhitespace(line.charAt(i)))                                
                             +            {                                                                                         
                             +                i++;                                                                                  
                             +            }                                                                                         
                             +            tokens[tokenCount++] = line.substring(start, i);                                          
                             +        }                                                                                             
                             +        if (tokenCount < maxTokens)                                                                   
                             +        {                                                                                             
                             +            String[] result = new String[tokenCount];                                                 
                             +            System.arraycopy(tokens, 0, result, 0, tokenCount);                                       
                             +            return result;                                                                            
                             +        }                                                                                             
                             +        return tokens;                                                                                
                             +    }                                                                                                 
                             +

                                  {                                                                                                 
                                      if (source.peek() != 'x')                                                                     
                             @@ -598,10 +634,23 @@

                             ===Issue===                                                                                            
                             ERROR: libFuzzer: timeout                                                                              
                                                                                                                                    
                             ===Evaluation Report===                                                                                
                             # Evaluation Report                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                    
                             ## Summary                                                                                             
                             The initial issue reports a libFuzzer timeout when exercising PDF parsing in Apache                    
                             PDFBox, indicating a hang or excessively long execution. A patch was introduced in                     
                             XrefParser.parseXrefTable() to bound XRef table parsing by adding maximum line length                  
                             and maximum section count checks, and by replacing String.split calls with a                           
                             precompiled whitespace Pattern. After applying the patch, the fuzzer still times out,                  
                             and the main thread remains stuck in regex matching (`Pattern.split`), as shown by a                   
                             thread dump.                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                    
                             ## Description                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                    
                             1. Initial Issue                                                                                       
                                - The harness logs a libFuzzer timeout with no further application-level error                      
                             messages.                                                                                              
                                - The fuzzer invokes `PDFParser.parse`, which calls into                                            
                             `XrefParser.parseXrefTable()`.                                                                         
                                - The absence of a crash suggests an infinite or very long-running loop, or                         
                             expensive operations in parsing.                                                                       
                                                                                                                                    
                             2. Observations in the Initial Issue                                                                   
                                - The fuzzer stalls for tens of seconds without progress.                                           
                                - No exceptions or warnings are emitted by the existing XRef parsing logic.                         
                                - The default parsing loop in `parseXrefTable()` reads lines and splits on                          
                             whitespace indefinitely.                                                                               
                                                                                                                                    
                             3. Patch Attempt                                                                                       
                                - Introduce two constants: `MAX_XREF_LINE_LENGTH` (4096 chars) and                                  
                             `MAX_XREF_SECTIONS` (1000).                                                                            
                                - Compile a `java.util.regex.Pattern WHITESPACE_PATTERN` for splitting, replacing                   
                             inline `String.split("\\s")`.                                                                          
                                - Increment a `sectionCount` on each loop iteration; if it exceeds                                  
                             `MAX_XREF_SECTIONS`, log a warning and return `false`.                                                 
                                - After reading each line, check `currentLine.length()` against                                     
                             `MAX_XREF_LINE_LENGTH`; if exceeded, log a warning and return `false`.                                 
                                - Apply the same line-length check and `Pattern.split` replacement in both the XRef                 
                             section header parsing and the entry-parsing subloop.                                                  
                                                                                                                                    
                                Patch context around line 598 in XrefParser.java:                                                   
                                ```java                                                                                             
                                    final int MAX_XREF_LINE_LENGTH = 4096;                                                          
                                    final int MAX_XREF_SECTIONS = 1000;                                                             
                                    final Pattern WHITESPACE_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\s");                                      
                                    int sectionCount = 0;                                                                           
                                    while (true) {                                                                                  
                                        if (++sectionCount > MAX_XREF_SECTIONS) { LOG.warn(...); return false; }                    
                                        String currentLine = parser.readLine();                                                     
                                        if (currentLine.length() > MAX_XREF_LINE_LENGTH) { LOG.warn(...); return                    
                             false; }                                                                                               
                                        String[] splitString = WHITESPACE_PATTERN.split(currentLine);                               
                                        ...                                                                                         
                                        // In entry loop:                                                                           
                                        currentLine = parser.readLine();                                                            
                                        if (currentLine.length() > MAX_XREF_LINE_LENGTH) { LOG.warn(...); return                    
                             false; }                                                                                               
                                        splitString = WHITESPACE_PATTERN.split(currentLine);                                        
                                        ...                                                                                         
                                    }                                                                                               
                                ```                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                    
                             4. Result After Patch                                                                                  
                                - The fuzzer still reports a libFuzzer timeout after 28 s.                                         
                                - The full thread dump shows the main thread stuck in                                             
                             `java.util.regex.Pattern$Start.match(...)` and `Pattern.split(...)`.                                   
                                - No warnings from the newly added checks appear in the log, indicating that                        
                             neither the maximum line length nor the maximum section count is being reached before                  
                             the hang.                                                                                              
                                - The regex splitting itself appears to be the hot spot, suggesting pathological                    
                             input causing catastrophic backtracking or excessively long matches in                                 
                             `Pattern.split`.                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                    
                             5. Areas for Further Investigation                                                                     
                                - The `parseXrefTable` loop termination conditions and the behavior of                              
                             `parser.readLine()` when fed overflowing or malformed input.                                           
                                - The complexity of the `WHITESPACE_PATTERN.split` call on very large or deeply                     
                             nested input strings.                                                                                  
                                - Downstream parsing logic that iterates over split resultswhether invalid line                    
                             formats could trigger repeated expensive operations.                                                   
                                - Alternative strategies for whitespace tokenization (e.g., manual scanning) and                    
                             for safe loop exits under adversarial input.                                                           
                                - The interaction between `XrefParser.parseXref` and surrounding parser state to                    
                             confirm that returned `false` from `parseXrefTable` propagates appropriately and halts                 
                             further parsing.                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                    
                             ## Initial Issue Log                                                                                   
                             Here is the initial issue log of the codebase:                                                         
                             <issue>                                                                                                
                             ERROR: libFuzzer: timeout                                                                              
                                                                                                                                    
                             </issue>                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                    
                             ## Additional Issue Log                                                                                
                             Here is the additional issue log after the last patch attempt:                                         
                             <additional_issue>                                                                                     
                             ERROR: libFuzzer: timeout                                                                              
                             2025-11-04 09:44:20                                                                                    
                             Full thread dump OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (17.0.2+8-86 mixed mode, sharing):                           
                                                                                                                                    
                             Threads class SMR info:                                                                                
                             _java_thread_list=0x00007fd1b45e4470, length=14, elements={

                             ## Notes                                                                                               
                             - All patch attempts are applied to the initial codebase. Reapply the the previous                     
                             patches if needed.

                             <code>                                                                                                 
                             pdfbox/src/main/java/org/apache/pdfbox/pdfparser/BaseParser.java:1162-1188                             
                             ```                                                                                                    
                             1162:    protected String readLine() throws IOException                                                
                             1163:    {                                                                                             
                             1164:        if (source.isEOF())                                                                       
                             1165:        {                                                                                         
                             1166:            throw new IOException( "Error: End-of-File, expected line at offset "                 
                             +                                                                                                      
                             1167:                    source.getPosition());                                                        
                             1168:        }                                                                                         
                             1169:                                                                                                  
                             1170:        StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder( 11 );                                           
                             1171:                                                                                                  
                             1172:        int c;                                                                                    
                             1173:        while ((c = source.read()) != -1)                                                         
                             1174:        {                                                                                         
                             1175:            // CR and LF are valid EOLs                                                           
                             1176:            if (isEOL(c))                                                                         
                             1177:            {                                                                                     
                             1178:                break;                                                                            
                             1179:            }                                                                                     
                             1180:            buffer.append( (char)c );                                                             
                             1181:        }                                                                                         
                             1182:        // CR+LF is also a valid EOL                                                              
                             1183:        if (isCR(c) && isLF(source.peek()))                                                       
                             1184:        {                                                                                         
                             1185:            source.read();                                                                        
                             1186:        }                                                                                         
                             1187:        return buffer.toString();                                                                 
                             1188:    }                                                                                             
                             ```                                                                                                    
                             </code>                                                                                                
                             <code>                                                                                                 
                             pdfbox/src/main/java/org/apache/pdfbox/pdfparser/XrefParser.java:600-610                               
                             ```                                                                                                    
                             600:        // Xref tables can have multiple sections. Each starts with a starting                     
                             object id and a count.                                                                                 
                             601:        while(true)                                                                                
                             602:        {                                                                                          
                             603:            String currentLine = parser.readLine();                                                
                             604:            String[] splitString = currentLine.split("\\s");                                       
                             605:            if (splitString.length != 2)                                                           
                             606:            {                                                                                      
                             607:                LOG.warn("Unexpected XRefTable Entry: {}", currentLine);                           
                             608:                return false;                                                                      
                             609:            }                                                                                      
                             610:            // first obj id                                                                        
                             ```

                             ```                                                                                                    
                             646:                //Ignore table contents                                                            
                             647:                currentLine = parser.readLine();

                             649:                if (splitString.length < 3)                                                        
                             650:                {                                                                                  
                             651:                    LOG.warn("invalid xref line: {}", currentLine);                                
                             652:                    break;                                                                         
                             ```
